section.section: In this section the following words have the meanings indicated.
"Commercial poultry producer" means any entity that contracts with a farmer to raise poultry for the producer on property owned or leased by the farmer.

text.section:
The purpose of the Project is to establish a cost share matching program to assist in the transportation of poultry or livestock manure from farms:
To be used on land with soil having the capacity to hold additional phosphorus; or
To be used in environmentally acceptable ways other than land application.

The State shall provide funding for the Project by matching the amount of funds contributed by the commercial poultry producer industry for eligible costs, as determined by the Department, associated with the transportation and handling of poultry litter. The State share may not exceed $10 per ton for poultry manure or 87.5% up to $20 per ton for livestock manure.
The Department of Agriculture shall adopt regulations authorizing the disbursement of cost-share matching funds consistent with the purposes of the Project.

The Department of Agriculture shall provide the assistance necessary to ensure that poultry or livestock manure is tested in accordance with departmental procedures before transportation of the manure occurs.
